API¶

Raw acquisition data extraction¶

class src.sensor.SensorDataReader[source]¶

Class to collect and format the raw sensor data values from the WBB and force plate acquisition files which are stored in the c3d file format (cf https://www.c3d.org/HTML/default.htm).

The locally compiled and installed binaries of the biomechanical toolkit python wrapper (http://biomechanical-toolkit.github.io/docs/Wrapping/Python/index.html) are used to read and extract the data.

get_frequency(filepath, point=False)[source]¶

Extract analog/point frequencies.

get_raw_data(filepath, balance_board=False)[source]¶

Extract and aggregate raw sensor data of interest.

Data preprocessing¶

class src.preprocess.DataPreprocessor[source]¶

Class that handles the preprocessing related tasks of the acquisition signal using the open source Scipy library.

More specifically, it relies on the implementations found in the latest release of the scipy signal processing package scipy.signal.

apply_detrending(input_signal)[source]¶

Detrend the input signal by removing a linear trend or just the mean of the signal.

Scipy documentation: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.1.0/reference/generated/scipy.signal.detrend.html#scipy.signal.detrend.

apply_filtering(input_signal, analog_frequency)[source]¶

Create and apply a low pass butterworth filter. The order and the cutoff frequencies of the filter can be specified through the configuration file.

Scipy documentation: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.1.0/reference/generated/scipy.signal.butter.html#scipy.signal.butter

Then it applies the butter digital filter forward and backward to the input signal. Scipy documentation: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.signal.filtfilt.html

apply_resampling(input_signal)[source]¶

Resample the input signal using polyphase resampling.

Scipy documentation: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.1.0/reference/generated/scipy.signal.resample_poly.html#scipy.signal.resample_poly

cut_data(input_signal, threshold=None)[source]¶

Cut beginning of the input signal based on a given threshold.

preprocess(input_signal, analog_frequency, balance_board=False)[source]¶

Pipeline all the preprocessing steps.

The resampling is only applied to the wii balance board data in order to match the force plate acquisition frequency.

Center of Pressure computations¶

Feature computations¶

class src.features.CopFeatures(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Base class for COP based features computations.

This class doesn’t implement any feature computations and is simply responsible for parsing the COP data that will be used in COP based features computations in both the time and frequency domains.

static compute_rd(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Function to compute the resultant distance vector from the x and y COP coordinates

static parse_cop_data(filepath)[source]¶

Parse cop data from an input file.

class src.time_features.AreaFeatures(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Class that implements the time domain area features computations derived from the COP positions.

compute_area_features()[source]¶

Compute all the area features and store them in a dictionary.

compute_confidence_circle_area()[source]¶

Compute the 95% confidence circle area (AREA-CC).

It is the area of a circle with a radius equal to the one-sided 95% confidence limit of the RD time series.

compute_confidence_elipse_area()[source]¶

Compute the 95% confidence elipse area (AREA-CE).

It is the area of the 95% bivariate confidence ellipse, which is expected to enclose approximately 95% of the points on the COP path.

compute_std_ap()[source]¶

Compute the standard deviation of the AP time series.

compute_std_ml()[source]¶

Compute the standard deviation of the ML time series.

compute_std_rd()[source]¶

Compute the standard deviation of the resultant distance time series.

summary()[source]¶

Print out a summary of the area features to standard output.

class src.time_features.DistanceFeatures(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Class that implements the time domain distance features computations derived from the COP positions.

compute_ap_mean_distance()[source]¶

Compute the average AP distance from the mean COP.

compute_ap_mean_velocity()[source]¶

Compute the average velocity of the COP in the AP direction.

compute_ap_path_length()[source]¶

Compute the total length of the COP path in the AP direction.

compute_ap_range()[source]¶

Compute the range in the AP direction.

compute_ap_rms_distance()[source]¶

Compute the root mean square AP distance from the mean COP.

compute_distance_features()[source]¶

Compute all the distance features and store them in a dictionary.

static compute_mean_distance(array)[source]¶

Compute the mean value of an array using the numpy mean implementation.

compute_ml_mean_distance()[source]¶

Compute the average ML distance from the mean COP.

compute_ml_mean_velocity()[source]¶

Compute the average velocity of the COP in the ML direction.

compute_ml_path_length()[source]¶

Compute the total length of the COP path in the ML direction.

compute_ml_range()[source]¶

Compute the range in the ML direction.

compute_ml_rms_distance()[source]¶

Compute the root mean square ML distance from the mean COP.

static compute_range(min_value, max_value)[source]¶

Compute the range.

The range is the maximum distance between any two points on the COP path.

compute_rd_mean_distance()[source]¶

Compute the average distance from the mean COP.

compute_rd_mean_velocity()[source]¶

Compute the average velocity of the COP.

compute_rd_path_length()[source]¶

Compute the total length of the COP path.

compute_rd_range()[source]¶

Compute the range of the resultant distance time series.

compute_rd_rms_distance()[source]¶

Compute the root mean square distance from the mean COP.

static compute_rms_distance(array)[source]¶

Compute the root mean square value of an array using the numpy mean, root and square implementations.

summary()[source]¶

Print out a summary of the distance features to standard output.

class src.time_features.HybridFeatures(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Class that implements the time domain hybrid features computations derived from the COP positions.

compute_fractal_dimension(d)[source]¶

Compute the fractal dimension (FD).

The fractal dimension (FD) is a unitless measure of the degree to which a curve fills the metric space which it encompasses.

compute_fractal_dimension_cc()[source]¶

Compute the fractal dimension-CC.

The fractal dimension-CC is based on the 95% confidence circle.

compute_fractal_dimension_ce()[source]¶

Compute the fractal dimension-CE.

The fractal dimension-CE is based on the 95% confidence elipse.

compute_hybrid_features()[source]¶

Compute all the hybrid features and store them in a dictionary.

compute_mean_frequency()[source]¶

Compute the mean frequency.

The mean frequency (MFREQ) is the rotational frequency,in revolutions per second or Hz, of the COP if it had traveled the total excursions around a circle with a radius of the mean distance.

compute_mean_frequency_ap()[source]¶

Compute the mean frequency in the AP direction.

The mean frequency-AP is the frequency, in Hz, of a sinusoidal oscillation with an average value of the mean distance-AP and a total path length of total excursions-AP.

compute_mean_frequency_ml()[source]¶

Compute the mean frequency in the ML direction.

The mean frequency-ML is the frequency, in Hz, of a sinusoidal oscillation with an average value of the mean distance-ML and a total path length of total excursions-ML.

compute_sway_area()[source]¶

Compute the sway area.

Sway area estimates the area enclosed by the COP path per unit of time.

summary()[source]¶

Print out a summary of the hybrid features to standard output.

class src.time_features.TimeFeatures(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Class that merges all the time domain features.

merge_time_features()[source]¶

Merge all the time domain features together.

summary()[source]¶

Print out a summary of the time features to standard output.

class src.frequency_features.FrequencyFeatures(cop_x, cop_y)[source]¶

Class that implements the frequency domain features derived from the COP positions.

compute_ap_f_peak()[source]¶

Function to compute the peak frequency in the AP direction.

compute_ap_power_frequency(n)[source]¶

Function to compute the n% power frequency in the AP direction.

compute_ap_power_spectral_density()[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectral density of the COP displacement in the AP direction.

compute_ap_power_spectrum_area()[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectrum area of the COP displacement in the AP direction.

compute_ap_total_power()[source]¶

Function to compute the total power in the AP direction.

compute_frequency_features()[source]¶

Compute all the frequency features and store them in a dictionary.

compute_ml_f_peak()[source]¶

Function to compute the peak frequency in the ML direction.

compute_ml_power_frequency(n)[source]¶

Function to compute the n% power frequency in the ML direction.

compute_ml_power_spectral_density()[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectral density of the COP displacement in the ML direction.

compute_ml_power_spectrum_area()[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectrum area of the COP displacement in the ML direction.

compute_ml_total_power()[source]¶

Function to compute the total power in the ML direction.

compute_power_spectral_density(array)[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectral density using the scipy implementation of the Welch method.”

Scipy documentation: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.signal.welch.html#scipy.signal.welch

compute_rd_f_peak()[source]¶

Function to compute the peak frequency.

compute_rd_power_frequency(n)[source]¶

Function to compute the n% power frequency.

The n% power frequency is the frequency below which n% of the total power is found.

compute_rd_power_spectral_density()[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectral density of the resultant distance vector of the COP displacement.

compute_rd_power_spectrum_area()[source]¶

Function to compute the power spectrum cumulative area of the COP displacement.

The cumulative integrated area is computed using the composite trapezoidal rule. Scipy documentation: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.integrate.cumtrapz.html

compute_rd_total_power()[source]¶

Function to compute the total power.

The total power (POWER) is the integrated area of the power spectrum.

summary()[source]¶

Print out a summary of the frequency features to standard output.
